ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:0.5_0: 64. The training rule on what is grave
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.2_0: Venerable Upananda the Sakyan had committed an offense of intentional emission of semen.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.3_0: He told his brother’s student about this,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.5_0: Soon afterwards another monk also committed an offense of intentional emission of semen. He asked the Sangha for probation,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.7_0: While he was on probation, he saw Upananda’s brother’s student and said to him,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.8_0: “I’ve committed an offense of intentional emission of semen. I asked the Sangha for probation, which I got. I’m now undergoing probation. Please remember me as such.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.9_0: “Do others who have committed this offense need to do the same?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.11_0: “Venerable Upananda committed this offense and told me not to tell anyone.”

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.16_0: “How can a monk knowingly conceal a monk’s grave offense?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.17_0: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.20_0: “... Foolish man, how can you do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.21_0: Foolish man, this won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.22_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.23.1_0: ‘If a monk knowingly conceals a monk’s grave offense, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.1_0: If it is a grave offense, and he perceives it as such, and he conceals it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.2_0: If it is a grave offense, but he is unsure of it, and he conceals it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.3_0: If it is a grave offense, but he perceives it as minor, and he conceals it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.4_0: If he conceals a minor offense, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.5_0: If he conceals the grave or minor misconduct of one who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.6_0: If it is a minor offense, but he perceives it as grave, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.7_0: If the offense is minor, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.8_0: If it is a minor offense, and he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.4_0: if he does not tell because he thinks the person he is telling about is cruel and harsh and that he might become a danger to life or to the living of the spiritual life;

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.10_0: The fourth rule, the training rule on what is grave, is finished.
